senses.de: To say what will happen in the future, often using reason or experience.
senses.ex: The economist is predicting that the economy will improve next year.

Tips.title: Future Events
Tips.description: Use 'predict' when discussing events you believe will happen, based on information.
Tips.example: Meteorologists predict heavy rain for tomorrow.

Tips.title: Reason or Experience
Tips.description: 'Predict' often implies you have a reason or past experience for your expectation.
Tips.example: Based on trends, I predict a rise in sales next quarter.

Tips.title: Not Certainty
Tips.description: Saying 'predict' does not guarantee it will happen; there's always uncertainty.
Tips.example: I predict he'll win the race, but anything can happen.

senses.de: To indicate in advance, to prefigure or presage.
senses.ex: His severe cough predicted a future health problem.

Tips.title: Early Signs
Tips.description: Use 'predict' when you notice signs indicating that something is likely to occur.
Tips.example: Dark clouds predict a storm coming soon.

Tips.title: Predict Problems
Tips.description: It's common to use 'predict' to warn about negative outcomes or issues.
Tips.example: Expert predicts a shortage of water if usage isn't reduced.

Tips.title: Not Always Negative
Tips.description: Predicting isn't just for bad outcomes; it can suggest positive developments too.
Tips.example: Technological advances predict a future of efficient energy use.

Anticipate.wordDefinition:
Anticipate means to expect or prepare for something to happen, even if it isn't certain. For example, you might anticipate getting an A on a test because you studied hard.

Anticipate is used more for things that are expected but not necessarily certain, while predict is used for things that can be determined with some level of accuracy based on data and knowledge.

Calculate.wordDefinition:
Calculate refers to a process of performing mathematical operations to arrive at a specific numerical result.

It usually involves using formulas or equations to find an exact answer based on given data. For example, calculating the area of a rectangle or solving for the value of x in an algebraic equation are both examples of calculations.

Calculate involves finding an exact or precise answer using given data and mathematical operations, while predict involves making an informed guess about what might happen in the future based on patterns or trends.

Forecast.wordDefinition:
The words forecast and predict are often used interchangeably, but there is a slight difference in their meaning.

Forecast usually refers to a calculated estimation or projection of future events or conditions using data analysis and statistical models.

It is often used in weather forecasting, economic forecasting, and business forecasting.

A forecast is a calculated estimation while a prediction is more of an assumption based on intuition. Both words can be used in various fields, but it depends on the context and the methods used to make the estimation.

Foretell.wordDefinition:
The words foretell and predict both mean to say or estimate what will happen in the future.

However, foretell often refers to a prediction made through supernatural or magical means, such as a fortune teller or prophet, while predict is a more general term for any type of forecast or estimation.

Predict is applicable in many fields, such as science, economics, and sports, while foretell is more often used in literature or mythology.

Essentially, both words mean to anticipate what will happen in the future, but foretell implies a mystical or supernatural element, while predict is a broader term used in various fields.

Presage.wordDefinition:
Presage means to have a feeling or intuition about a future event without any scientific or logical evidence to support it. It is based more on superstition, belief, or instinct.

Thus, predict is used in situations where one can use available information to anticipate an outcome, while presage is used in situations where one relies on vague feelings or signs to foretell an outcome.

Project.wordDefinition:
Project means to use information that is currently available to plan or estimate a future outcome. It is based on a set of assumptions and may involve some degree of uncertainty.

In simpler terms, predicting is making an educated guess about something that will happen in the future by analyzing data, while projecting is using current information to plan or estimate a future outcome based on a set of assumptions.

Prophesy.wordDefinition:
Prophesy refers to making predictions based on a supposed divine or supernatural source.

So, while both words refer to making predictions about the future, predict relies on logic and reasoning, while prophesy involves faith and belief in a higher power.

Speculate.wordDefinition:
Speculate, on the other hand, means to make a guess or assumption about something without any evidence or proof.

It is often used in less formal contexts such as speculating about who will win a game or speculating about the plot of a movie.

Predict involves analyzing information to make a logical guess about the future while speculate involves making a guess without any substantial evidence or data.

quotes.Text: I never want to turn something down because I'm afraid to do it, because of some idea of image or whatever. That was never anything I set out to do. In fact, the opposite, I always want to confuse people in terms of any kind of image and be unpredictable in any kind of movie I make.
quotes.Title: Welsh Actor
quotes.Name: Christian Bale

quotes.Text: I don't think about a legacy; I think about my life, because I've had quite an unpredictable life.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Hillary Clinton

quotes.Text: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
quotes.Title: American First Lady
quotes.Name: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.Text: It's a combination of life being unpredictable, and you being super dumb.
quotes.Title: American Screenwriter
quotes.Name: Aaron Sorkin

quotes.Text: I'd be kidding if I said that I predicted the financial collapse.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Fareed Zakaria

quotes.Text: One can't predict the weather more than a few days in advance.
quotes.Title: English Physicist
quotes.Name: Stephen Hawking

quotes.Text: Like women, life is unpredictable and a huge risk.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Vivek Oberoi
